Articles.Content:
I hacked together a web-index for the [<abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/100067-The-Comprehensive-Kerbal-Archive-Network-%28CKAN%29-Package-Manager-v1-6-22-9-Jun-2015) where you currently can just view all entries from the main <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>-repository in better-readable format than JSON.

You can try the new (rewrite) version on [https://brohlsoft.de/apps/<abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">ckan</abbr>/](https://brohlsoft.de/apps/ckan/)

As a side-effect I am mirroring the main <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> index dump (lagging behind some hours) at [https://brohlsoft.de/apps/<abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">ckan</abbr>/latest.tar.gz](https://brohlsoft.de/apps/ckan/latest.tar.gz)

For the old version, sources are available (but not very pretty) on [https://bitbucket.org/janbrohl/<abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">ckan</abbr>-web](https://bitbucket.org/janbrohl/ckan-web) license is [BSD-3-clause](http://spdx.org/licenses/BSD-3-Clause)

**Edited <time datetime="2016-06-24T22:48:17Z" title="06/24/2016 10:48  PM" data-short="8 yr">June 24, 2016</time> by Blauerdaemon**
  
Rerelease
Quite a while ago: Added option to export data from the index in [KSP-AVC](http://ksp.cybutek.net/kspavc/Documents/README.htm) format, too. (Not sure if valid)
I just found out about it and I might. I remember wanting it a month ago, but I don't remember why.
Started working on a tool to help create (later also edit) CKAN-entries. Have a look at [https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/metadata-webtool](https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/metadata-webtool)

> 
> 
> On 5/31/2016 at 4:59 PM, Blauerdaemon said:
> 
> 
> Started working on a tool to help create (later also edit) CKAN-entries. Have a look at [https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/metadata-webtool](https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/metadata-webtool)
> 

Oh sweet joy. Can I help please?

Want to test this as a ~~victim~~  volunteer  ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P"). Have got a mod idea for testing that will not cause any harm if it goes horribly wrong. Basically just a flag to start off from Github before moving onto other sites variations. Plus adding dependencies or weird folder structures later on. If I break my own mod with this. No harm done.

Honestly the actual .netkan is easier to write manually for this one. However I want to know if someone can do this automatically without support from the CKAN people. Already seeing a few problems in the old version and have a snag with new pre-release. Minor stuff really that does not require an issue report on Github. I rather have a chat to you directly just now.

Can I send you a PM with the details?

Sure, PM me as much as you want.

I am glad you want to help. The current version generates a netkan file and enters it in a github-issue for you. Then these would be added to the netkan-index by one of the CKAN people. Generating a complete pull request from the tool is planned (so the CKAN people would just have to OK it) but not yet implemented.

If you want you can try a slightly outdated testing/preview version on [https://ksp-ckan.github.io/metadata-webtool/](https://ksp-ckan.github.io/metadata-webtool/)

I just want to mention that I am not a member of the KSP-CKAN team so nothing I might say should be regarded as "official" in that area.
